text: Dayton S. Mak (10 July 1917 - 16 March 2018) was a U.S. diplomat. He served posts in England, Libya, Lebanon, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Germany. He was the first U.S. ambassador of Kuwait. Mak was also former Director of the Bureau of Intelligence and Research, for Near East South Asia Affairs. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:American centenarians Category:People from Sioux Falls, South Dakota
title: Dayton S. Mak
